snippet: Foreign Minister Avigdor Lieberman said he saw no reason to resign after prosecutors announced that he would be formally charged only with breach of trust instead of fraud and money laundering.
abstract: Israeli Foreign Min Avigdor Lieberman will be charged with breach of trust but not indicted on more serious corruption charges after long investigation into his business dealings.

byline.contributor: Myra Noveck and Gabby Sobelman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Foreign Minister Avigdor Lieberman said he saw no reason to resign after prosecutors announced that he would be formally charged only with breach of trust instead of fraud and money laundering.

headline.seo: Israeli Foreign Minister, Avigdor Lieberman, Faces Indictment on Lesser Charges
headline.main: Israeli Foreign Minister Faces Indictment on Lesser Charges
headline.print_headline: Israeli Foreign Minister Faces Indictment on Lesser Charges
